pages.title: Creature Traps
pages.text: You can use traps to help catch some of the creatures in the mod. There are three traps: for land-living invertebrates, like insects; for ground-living animals; and for water animals. If you place a trap in a biome and bait it it will be able to catch creatures whose diets match the bait. If there are no available creatures, the trap will tell you:

try using a different bait, or else move to a different biome. Once the trap has caught something, you can release it automatically by applying a redstone signal to the trap (eg. a button or lever, etc), or you can click the trap with a jar, cage or bucket to catch the mob as appropriate. A full trap also powers a comparator output.
If you need some way to mark the position of your water traps, you can use the buoy to float above them on the surface.
